definitions.text: a body of students who are taught together
examples: early morning classes are always sleepy

definitions.text: a relative position or degree of value in a graded group
the gradient of a slope or road or other surface
examples: the road had a steep grade

definitions.text: a number or letter indicating quality (especially of a student's performance)
examples: she made good marks in algebra
what was your score on your homework?

definitions.text: the height of the ground on which something stands
examples: the base of the tower was below grade

definitions.text: a position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality
examples: a high level of care is required
it is all a matter of degree

definitions.text: a variety of cattle produced by crossbreeding with a superior breed
assign a rank or rating to
examples: how would you rank these students?
The restaurant is rated highly in the food guide

definitions.text: assign a grade or rank to, according to one's evaluation
determine the grade of or assign a grade to
